item.title: My Books of 2019
item.description: Reading has always been a big part of my life and 2019 was a big year in terms of reading for me. I was able to increase the number of book I read from number in 2018 to 20 in 2019. I read books NON-FICTION Daily rituals by Mason Curry The hard things about hard things by Ben Horowitz Thinking fast and slow by Daniel Kahneman Design a better business by a bunch of writers Strategic design by another set of writers Becoming by Michelle Obama Platform: The art and science of personal branding by Cynthia Something Fluent forever by Gabriel Wyner How to be interesting by Jessica Hagy

item.title: Immigr8: Improving the journey of Migrant workers to Canada using design thinking
Cupra Vision: A vision of sports driving
Walkable: Designing a walking experience to discover neighbourhoods in Barcelona
About Yinka Adesesan
item.description: I’m a business designer with a background in visual communication, UX design and technology education. I help global organisations capture, create and communicate with clarity using design thinking. I’m currently spending my days helping fortune 1000 companies design better products at DMI. In my evenings, Iâ€™m finding ways to help Nigerian self-taught designers level up their design skills using initiatives like LogoMarch. On weekends, I read hard science fiction and build tech things using no-code tools.
